help.description: A string to display when calling with the `help` argument.
help.title: Help

render_by_default.description: A list of string fields to wrap with jinja braces and render by default.
render_by_default.title: Render By Default

render_exclude.description: A list of field names to not render.
render_exclude.title: Render Exclude

is_public.title: Is Public

skip_output.description: A flag to skip the output and not set the key. Can also be set within a hook call.
skip_output.title: Skip Output

kwargs.description: A field name of type dict to map additional arguments to.
kwargs.title: Kwargs

objects.description: The object to be pretty printed.
objects.title: Objects

indent.description: Specifies the amount of indentation added for each nesting level.
indent.title: Indent

width.description: Specifies the desired maximum number of characters per line in the output. If a structure cannot be formatted within the width constraint, a best effort will be made.
width.title: Width

depth.description: Controls the number of nesting levels which may be printed; if the data structure being printed is too deep, the next contained level is replaced by .... By default, there is no constraint on the depth of the objects being formatted.
depth.title: Depth

compact.description: Impacts the way that long sequences (lists, tuples, sets, etc) are formatted. If compact is false (the default) then each item of a sequence will be formatted on a separate line. If compact is true, as many items as will fit within the width will be formatted on each output line.
compact.title: Compact

sort_dicts.description: If sort_dicts is true (the default), dictionaries will be formatted with their keys sorted, otherwise they will display in insertion order.
sort_dicts.title: Sort Dicts

underscore_numbers.description: If underscore_numbers is true, integers will be formatted with the _ character for a thousands separator, otherwise underscores are not displayed (the default).
underscore_numbers.title: Underscore Numbers
